summary: This is an internal email from the U.S. Marshals Service reporting that Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at MCC New York with a noose around his neck on the morning of July 25, 2019. He was placed on suicide watch, and his cellmate reported being threatened. The incident is under investigation by the Bureau of Prisons.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Found in his cell at MCC New York with a noose around his neck, placed on suicide watch.

persons.name: Associate Warden
persons.role: Associate Warden at MCC New York
persons.context: Reported the incident regarding Jeffrey Epstein to the U.S. Marshals Service.

persons.name: Supervisory Deputy United States Marshal
persons.role: Supervisory Deputy United States Marshal, Southern District of New York
persons.context: Author of the email reporting the incident.

connections.description: The Associate Warden at MCC New York reported on Epstein's condition and status in custody.
The Supervisory Deputy U.S. Marshal documented and reported the incident involving Epstein.

events.title: Epstein Found with Noose in Cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at MCC New York at 0127 hours in a fetal position with a noose around his neck. He was escorted to medical, assessed, and placed on suicide watch, later downgraded to suicide observation.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at MCC New York on July 25, 2019, at 0127 hours with a noose around his neck.
Epstein was initially placed on suicide watch and later downgraded to suicide observation.
Epstein's cellmate reported being threatened to be killed, according to the Associate Warden.
The incident is under investigation by the Bureau of Prisons (BOP).
